title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.5 - Submission of papers to Surrogate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.5 - Submission of papers to Surrogate

State Regulations

All papers for signature or consideration of
the Surrogate shall be presented in the first instance to the clerk of the
court in the appropriate courtroom or clerk's office, except that where the
clerk is unavailable or the Surrogate so directs, papers may be filed with the

Surrogate and a copy filed with the clerk at the first available opportunity. Where appropriate, orders to show cause may be submitted directly to the

Department of Law or the Surrogate. The papers shall be clearly addressed to
the Surrogate for whom they are intended, and prominently show the nature of
the papers, the title and clerk's file number of the proceeding in which they
are filed, and the name of the attorney or party submitting
them. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
207.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
